revision.text:
{{About|the footballer|the politician|Alberto Moreno (politician)}} {{Spanish name|Moreno|Pérez}} {{EngvarB|date=October 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Alberto Moreno | image = Spartak Moscow- Liverpool (cropped).jpg | image_size = 175 | caption = Moreno with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2017 | fullname = Alberto Moreno Pérez<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|7|5|df=y}}<ref name=SW>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/alberto-moreno-perez/192742/ |title=Alberto Moreno |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=19 May 2016}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Seville]], Spain | height = 1.71 m<ref name=SW/> | position = [[Left back]] | currentclub = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = 2004–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] | years1 = 2011–2013 | clubs1 = [[Sevilla Atlético]] | caps1 = 49 | goals1 = 7 | years2 = 2012–2014 | clubs2 = [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] | caps2 = 45 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2014– | clubs3 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps3 = 90 | goals3 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 10 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013– | nationalteam2 = [[Spain national football team|Spain]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 06:55, 6 December 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:06, 20 March 2018 (UTC) }} '''Alberto Moreno Pérez''' ({{IPA-es|alˈβeɾto moˈɾeno ˈpeɾeθ}}; born 5 July 1992) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[left back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]].
An academy graduate of local side [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]], he made his senior debut for the club's reserve side in 2011 before going on to feature in 62 official games for the first team. During his time with Sevilla, he was part of the squad which won the [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] title in 2014. The following season, he joined [[Premier League]] club Liverpool for a reported fee of £12 million where he has since made over 100 appearances and collected runners-up medals in the [[EFL Cup]], Europa League and [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]].
Moreno was part of the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain under-21 team]] that won the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2013 UEFA European Championship]] and made his [[Spain national football team|senior]] debut the same year.
==Club career== [[File:Alberto Moreno (cropped).jpg|left|thumb|351x351px|Moreno with Sevilla in 2013.]]
=== Sevilla === Moreno was born in the [[Andalusia|Andalusian]] capital of [[Seville]] and at the age of 13 joined his local side, [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Alberto Moreno: Sevilla is my home but I want to win|url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/spanish-football/2016/05/17/573afbdd22601de0048b45b0.html|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=Marca|date=17 May 2016}}</ref><ref name=ff2>{{cite news|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/alberto-moreno-prem-bound-la-liga-left-back-who-bettered-gareth-bale|title=Alberto Moreno: The Prem-bound La Liga left-back who bettered Gareth Bale|publisher=Four Four Two|last=Wilkes|first=Paul|date=13 April 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref> There he progressed through the club's youth academy and made his senior debut for the reserve side, [[Sevilla Atlético]], on 12 June 2011 in a 3–1 home win over [[CD Guadalajara (Spain)|Guadalajara]] in the [[Segunda División B]] play-offs. The club ultimately lost 5–4 on aggregate, however.<ref>{{cite news|title=El Sevilla Atlético roza la remontada|trans-title=Sevilla Atlético grind a comeback|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/06/12/futbol/mas_futbol/1307914535.html|accessdate=12 April 2016|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid|date=12 June 2011|language=Spanish}}</ref> His [[2011–12 Segunda División B|first full season]] followed thereafter during which he scored four goals in 30 games, including his first senior goal directly from a [[corner kick]] in added time against [[Cádiz CF|Cádiz]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Victoria del Sevilla Atlético sobre el Cádiz con gol olímpico de Alberto|trans-title=Victory for Sevilla Atlético over Cádiz with an Olympic goal by Alberto|url=http://sevilla.eldesmarque.com/sevilla-futbol-club/41927-victoria-del-sevilla-atletico-sobre-el-cadiz-con-gol-olimpico-de-alberto|accessdate=12 April 2016|publisher=El Desmarque|date=13 November 2011|language=Spanish}}</ref> Whilst playing for the reserve side, Moreno operated under the tutelage of Ramón Tejada who rotated him between attacking and defensive positions down the left-flank of the field.<ref name=ff2/> The positional rotation was later credited for his tactical awareness which contributed to him making his first team, and [[La Liga]] debut.<ref name=ff2/> This took place on 8 April 2012 when he came on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Manu del Moral]] in the last minutes of a 1–0 away loss against [[Athletic Bilbao]].<ref name=ff2/><ref>[http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/323747/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739 "Llorente leads Leones to victory"]. ESPN FC. 8 April 2012.\{{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130409053057/http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/323747/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739 |date=9 April 2013 }}</ref>
In February 2013, Moreno was permanently promoted to the first team and he scored his first professional goal on 20 October, netting the second in a 2–2 draw at [[Real Valladolid]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ligabbva.com/3208_sevilla/1977189_alberto-moreno-reconoce-que-vive-en-una-pompa-de-jabon-en-el-primer-equipo.html|title=Alberto Moreno reconoce que vive "en una pompa de jabón" en el primer equipo |trans-title=Alberto Moreno acknowledges living in "a bubble" in first team|publisher=La Liga|language=Spanish|date=20 March 2013|accessdate=23 April 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/373135/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Valladolid snatch unlikely draw |publisher=ESPN FC |date=20 October 2013 |accessdate=25 November 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131223215037/http://espnfc.com/en/report/373135/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=23 December 2013 |df=dmy }}</ref> He ultimately made 17 appearances during a campaign blemished only by a straight red card he received following a confrontation with [[Gabi (footballer)|Gabi]] inn a league match against [[Atlético Madrid]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Atlético Madrid 1–1 Sevilla|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25717734|accessdate=12 April 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 January 2014}}</ref><ref name=ss>{{cite news|url= https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/9330407/transfer-news-liverpool-make-offer-for-sevilla-left-back-alberto-moreno|title=Transfer news: Liverpool linked with Sevilla left-back Alberto Moreno|publisher=Sky Sports|date=30 May 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref> He enjoyed a breakthrough season in the [[2013–14 La Liga|2013–14 campaign]] where he made 44 appearances in total for the club, including 14 in Sevilla's [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|victorious run]] in the [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref name=ss/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/28822500|title=Alberto Moreno completes £12m Liverpool move from Sevilla|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Smith|first=Ben|date=16 August 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref> His performances throughout the season also contributed towards Sevilla ending the fifth in the league and earned him a spot in [[Spain national football team|Spain]]'s provisional squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref name=ss/>
On 12 August 2014, and on the eve of Sevilla's [[2014 UEFA Super Cup]] match against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], Moreno was withdrawn from the club's match-day squad after the club agreed a £12 million deal with [[Premier League]] side [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for his signature.<ref>{{cite news|title=Alberto Moreno: Liverpool agree £12m fee with Sevilla for defender|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28765444|publisher=BBC|date=12 August 2014|accessdate=13 August 2014}}</ref> Following the match, Moreno was in tears and had to be consoled as he was given a send off by the club's fans.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/liverpool-bound-alberto-moreno-bids-emotional-4042968|title=Liverpool-bound Alberto Moreno bids emotional farewell to Sevilla team-mates after Super Cup defeat|publisher=Daily Mirror|last=Prendenerville|first=Liam|date=13 August 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref> He later explained that he was emotional to be leaving Sevilla as the club was the "club of his life" but that he was equally motivated to succeed at Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/alberto-moreno-to-liverpool-defender-admits-it-has-been-emotional-leaving-seville-but-is-super-9667012.html|title= Alberto Moreno to Liverpool: Defender admits it has been emotional leaving Seville but is 'super-motivated' to succeed at Anfield|publisher=The Independent|last=Orr|first=James|date=13 August 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== On 16 August 2014, Moreno officially completed his move to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and he made his debut for the club 10 days later in a 3–1 league loss to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Alberto Moreno completes £12m Liverpool move from Sevilla|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28822500|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=16 August 2014|date=16 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Winter|first=Henry|title=Manchester City 3 Liverpool 1: Stevan Jovetic and Sergio Agüero on target as Premier League champions secure win|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11055354/Manchester-City-3-Liverpool-1-Stevan-Jovetic-and-Sergio-Aguero-on-target-as-Premier-League-champions-secure-win.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|accessdate=25 August 2014|date=25 August 2014}}</ref> He then scored his first goal on 31 August, netting the third goal in 3–0 away win against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] after dispossessing [[Andros Townsend]] and sprinting 40 yards to score.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28917060 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 0-3 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://ftw.usatoday.com/2014/08/liverpool-tottenham-alberto-moreno-goal |title=Alberto Moreno’s first goal for Liverpool was spectacular |newspaper=USA Today |location=Tysons Corner |date=31 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014}}</ref> He scored again in December, against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], but ultimately endured an inconsistent debut season at [[Anfield]], with his attacking output not matched by his defensive performances.<ref>{{cite news |last=Bascombe |first=Chris |title=Liverpool 4 Swansea City 1: Adam Lallana shows his class as Liverpool cruise to victory |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11316920/Liverpool-4-Swansea-City-1-Adam-Lallana-shows-his-class-as-Liverpool-cruise-to-victory.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=30 December 2014 |date=29 December 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.thisisanfield.com/2015/06/alberto-moreno-201415-season-review-wayward-first-season-spanish-left-back/|title=Alberto Moreno 2014/15 Season Review: A difficult first season for the Spanish left-back|publisher=This is Anfield|last=Lusby|first=Jack|date=4 June 2015|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref>
Moreno spent the first four games of the [[2015–16 Liverpool F.C. season|next season]] as a substitute as new teammate [[Joe Gomez (footballer)|Joe Gomez]] started in his position. However, on 20 September 2015, he made his first league start of the season, providing the assist for [[Danny Ings]]' first Liverpool goal in a 1–1 draw against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]],<ref>{{cite news|last=Jennings|first=Patrick|title=Liverpool 1 - 1 Norwich City|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34236959|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=21 September 2015|date=20 September 2015}}</ref> and was praised for his man of the match performance.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Usher|first1=David|title=Simon Mignolet's errors undoes Danny Ings' impact for Liverpool|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/liverpool/364/blog/post/2622929/simon-mignolets-errors-undoes-danny-ings-liverpool-impact|publisher=ESPN FC|accessdate=21 September 2015|date=20 September 2015}}</ref> His performance in the [[2016 UEFA Europa League Final]], where Liverpool lost 1–3 to his former club Sevilla, was heavily criticised by pundits and journalists for positioning and defensive errors.<ref>{{cite news|last=Prentice|first=David|title=Moreno slammed by McManaman and Owen for second-half display|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alberto-moreno-europa-league-final-11354159l|newspaper=Liverpool Echo|location=Liverpool|accessdate=19 May 2016|date=18 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Mariner|first1=James|title=Liverpool 1 Sevilla 3: Jamie Carragher deletes Twitter message slagging off Alberto Moreno|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/carragher-tweets-message-slagging-off-moreno-before-deleting-it-a7037036.html|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=The Independent|date=19 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Doyle|first=Ian|title=Liverpool 1-3 Sevilla player ratings: 4-4-2...not a formation but the three worst performances|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-1-3-sevilla-player-11354169|newspaper=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=19 May 2016|date=18 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Was Alberto Moreno's Europa League horror show the biggest individual nightmare in a final?|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/05/19/was-alberto-morenos-horror-show-for-liverpool-against-sevilla-th/alberto-moreno/|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=19 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Europa League final: What next for Jurgen Klopp and Liverpool?|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36326487|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 May 2016}}</ref> [[File:Spartak Moscow- Liverpool.jpg|thumb|Moreno (bottom-left) lining-up for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]'s [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] match against [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] in 2017.]] On 14 August 2016, Moreno started in the [[2016–17 Liverpool F.C. season|first game]] of the season, a 4–3 win at Arsenal, where he conceded a penalty and was criticised heavily for his performance, prompting a defence from his manager [[Jürgen Klopp]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-news-jurgen-klopp-defends-alberto-moreno-after-left-back-is-criticised-for-arsenal-a7197401.html|title=Jurgen Klopp defends Alberto Moreno after left-back is widely criticised for Arsenal performance|date=18 August 2016|publisher=}}</ref> Despite his manager's intervention, he was dropped and used only as a late substitute for the next game, an 0–2 loss at [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/burnley-v-liverpool-team-news-11776769|title=Moreno dropped by Jurgen Klopp|last=Pearce|first=James|date=2016-08-20|newspaper=Liverpool Echo |access-date=2017-04-09}}</ref> He made 18 appearances over the season, just eight as a starter, as [[James Milner]] was preferred in the left-back slot.<ref name=Napoli>{{cite news|last1=Price|first1=Glenn|title=Liverpool reject €12.5m Napoli bid for Alberto Moreno - source|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/soccer-transfers/story/3146998/liverpool-reject-napoli-bid-for-alberto-moreno-source|accessdate=22 June 2017|publisher=ESPN FC|date=22 June 2017}}</ref>
In April 2017, [[Serie A]] teams [[A.C. Milan|AC Milan]] and [[Inter Milan]] spoke to Liverpool about a transfer for Moreno, and in June the Reds rejected a €12.5 million bid for him from another Italian club, [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]].<ref name=Napoli/>
Moreno played more frequently at the start of the 2017–18 season,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lowe|first1=Sid|title=Alberto Moreno: ‘I used to think attack, attack, attack – but I have changed’|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/nov/16/alberto-moreno-interview-attack-changed-liverpool|accessdate=28 November 2017|newspaper=The Guardian|date=16 November 2017}}</ref> but was criticised in November in a Champions League group game against Sevilla, in which Liverpool led 3–0 at half time but drew 3–3, and was defended by Klopp.<ref>{{cite news|last1=de Menezes|first1=Jack|title=Roy Keane tears into Alberto Moreno and says performance against Sevilla should be the final straw for Liverpool|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/liverpool-news-roy-keane-alberto-moreno-sevilla-performance-not-good-enough-vs-chelsea-a8071211.html|accessdate=28 November 2017|newspaper=The Independent|date=23 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Wilson|first1=Jonathan|title=Liverpool’s defensive problems do not begin and end with Alberto Moreno|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2017/nov/23/liverpool-alberto-moreno-defensive-problems-holding-midfielder|accessdate=28 November 2017|newspaper=The Guardian|date=23 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Pearce|first1=James|title=Jurgen Klopp's message to underfire Liverpool left-back Alberto Moreno|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/jurgen-klopps-message-underfire-liverpool-13951028|accessdate=28 November 2017|newspaper=Liverpool Echo|date=24 November 2017}}</ref> He ultimately lost his position to new signing [[Andrew Robertson]] for the rest of the season.
==International career== ===Youth=== Moreno represented the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spanish under-21s]] at the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2013 UEFA European Championship]], being first-choice as he helped them [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship Final|retain their European title]]. Following the competition's completion he was announced in UEFA's official [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Team of the Tournament|team of the tournament]].<ref name=2013U21>{{cite news |title=Thiago leads all-star squad dominated by Spain |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/news/newsid=1966169.html |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=21 June 2013 }}</ref>
===Senior=== Moreno was called up to the [[Spain national football team|senior team]] on 4 October 2013 for the last [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|qualifier]] against [[Georgia national football team|Georgia]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2013/10/04/seleccion/1380881591_324137.html|title=Vicente del Bosque recluta a cuatro del Atlético de Madrid|trans-title=Vicente del Bosque calls four from Atlético de Madrid|newspaper=Diario AS|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=4 October 2013|accessdate=14 October 2013}}</ref> and he made his debut on 15 October, playing the full 90 minutes in a 2–0 win in [[Albacete]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008421/postmatch/report/index.html#spain+clinch+finals+spot|title=Spain top Group I to clinch finals place|publisher=UEFA|date=15 October 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref>
Moreno was included in [[Vicente del Bosque|Vicente del Bosque's]] 30-man provisional list for the tournament in Brazil, but was one of seven players cut from the final squad.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27647635|title=World Cup 2014: Spain drop Alvaro Negredo and Jesus Navas|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 May 2014|accessdate=31 May 2014}}</ref>
Over three years since his last cap, Moreno was recalled by [[Julen Lopetegui]] for friendlies against [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] and [[Russia national football team|Russia]] in November 2017.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Marrow|first1=Alex|title=Alberto Moreno earns Spain recall after Liverpool resurgence|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11111806/alberto-moreno-earns-spain-recall-after-liverpool-resurgence|accessdate=28 November 2017|publisher=Sky Sports|date=3 November 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Moreno has many tattoos. In April 2016, he had his leg decorated with an image of a gun-toting [[Common chimpanzee|chimpanzee]] dressed in a suit and wearing headphones; [[ESPN FC]]'s verdict was "Please don't ask, because we haven't got the slightest clue."<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wright|first1=Chris|title=Liverpool's Alberto Moreno unveils perplexing new monkey tattoo|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/2849021/liverpools-alberto-moreno-unveils-perplexing-monkey-tattoo|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=ESPN FC|date=12 April 2016}}</ref> The back of his leg is decorated with the coordinates of his hometown's [[Plaza de España (Seville)|Plaza de España]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Alberto Moreno's Sevilla tattoo|url=http://www.express.co.uk/pictures/sport/6201/Alberto-Moreno-Liverpool-Sevilla-tattoo-sportgalleries/Alberto-Moreno-135465|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=Daily Express|date=18 May 2016}}</ref> Moreno has two children with his partner Lilia Granadilla.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alberto-morenos-performance-against-southampton-13921699|title=Why Alberto Moreno's performance against Southampton deserves extra credit|publisher=Liverpool Echo|last=Kelly|first=Andy|date=18 November 2017|accessdate=18 November 2017}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 7 January 2019}}

in [[Copa del Rey]] and [[FA Cup]]}} !colspan=2|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=4|[[Sevilla Atlético]] |[[2010–11 Segunda División B|2010–11]]<ref>{{cite web |title=Alberto Moreno: Alberto Moreno Pérez: Matches: 2010–11 |url=http://www.bdfutbol.com/en/p/j7010.html?temp=2010-11 |publisher=BDFutbol |accessdate=20 March 2018}}</ref> |[[Segunda División B]] |0||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||1{{efn|Appearances in [[Segunda División B play-offs]]}}||0||1||0 |- |[[2011–12 Segunda División B|2011–12]]<ref name="2011/12">{{cite web |title=Alberto Moreno: Alberto Moreno Pérez: Matches: 2011–12 |url=http://www.bdfutbol.com/en/p/j7010.html?temp=2011-12 |publisher=BDFutbol |accessdate=20 March 2018}}</ref> |Segunda División B |30||4||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||30||4 |- |[[2012–13 Segunda División B|2012–13]]<ref name="2012/13">{{cite web |title=Alberto Moreno: Alberto Moreno Pérez: Matches: 2012–13 |url=http://www.bdfutbol.com/en/p/j7010.html?temp=2012-13 |publisher=BDFutbol |accessdate=20 March 2018}}</ref> |Segunda División B |19||3||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||19||3 |- !colspan=2|Total !49!!7!!colspan=2|—!!colspan=2|—!!1!!0!!50!!7 |- |rowspan=4|[[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] |[[2011–12 Sevilla FC season|2011–12]]<ref name="2011/12"/> |[[La Liga]] |1||0||0||0||colspan=2|—||0||0||1||0 |- |[[2012–13 Sevilla FC season|2012–13]]<ref name="2012/13"/> |La Liga |15||0||2||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||17||0 |- |[[2013–14 Sevilla FC season|2013–14]]<ref>{{cite web |title=Alberto Moreno: Alberto Moreno Pérez: Matches: 2013–14 |url=http://www.bdfutbol.com/en/p/j7010.html?temp=2013-14 |publisher=BDFutbol |accessdate=20 March 2018}}</ref> |La Liga |29||3||1||0||colspan=2|—||14{{efn|name=UEL|Appearances in [[UEFA Europa League]]}}||0||44||3 |- !colspan=2|Total !45!!3!!3!!0!!colspan=2|—!!14!!0!!62!!3 |- |rowspan=6|[[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] |[[2014–15 Liverpool F.C. season|2014–15]]<ref name=sb1415>{{soccerbase season|64850|2014|name=Alberto Moreno Perez|accessdate=20 March 2018}}</ref> |[[Premier League]] |28||2||4||0||2||0||7{{efn|Five appearances in [[UEFA Champions League]], two in UEFA Europa
